name: House of Robots and Cyborgs Quiz | Movie Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: What performer from "Cannonball Run" fought off a murdering, lovesick robot in "Saturn 3"?
questions.explanation:
Farrah Fawcett.

	Adam (Kirk Douglas) and Alex (Farrah Fawcett) lived peacefully on Titan, Saturn's third moon, until Benson (Harvey Keitel) showed up with his robot, Hector, which fell in love with Alex and became violent. Farrah Fawcett first became famous from the TV show "Charlie's Angels".  She has appeared on the big screen "Extremities", but is more famous for TV movies, including "The Burning Bed" (1984) and "Small Sacrifices".

questions.text: What performer from "Psycho" got attacked by a robot in "The Black Hole"?
questions.explanation:
Anthony Perkins.

	After having played as a cross-dressing murderer in "Psycho", Anthony Perkins  later played a character who got killed by a robot in "The Black Hole" after landing in a space station and becoming friends with the man who ran the place.   Anthony Perkins appeared in various TV shows, plays, and movies over the years, including "Pretty Poison", "Catch 22", and "Murder on the Orient Express".

questions.text: Who played Robocop 2 in the movie "Robocop 2"?
questions.explanation:
Tom Noonan.

	This hardly ever happens, but in the sequel called "Robocop 2" there really was a Robocop 2, who was the second person turned into a functioning cyborg by OCP.  The story involved OCP trying to buy the city of Detroit after it went bankrupt.  The mayor decided to raise money by having a telethon.  Meanwhile, a drug dealer (Tom Noonan) died in the hospital after Robocop shot him.  OCP decided to turn the drug dealer into the next Robocop, and ordered him to kill the mayor.  Along the way he killed the surviving leaders of his old gang. Tom Noonan has appeared in many movies, including "Eddie Macon's Run", "The Last Action Hero", "Manhunter", and "The Monster Squad".

questions.text: Which actor who played Batman played a man attacked by a robot on Mars in "Red Planet"?
questions.explanation:
Val Kilmer.

	In the movie "Red Planet" some people landed on Mars, but before they got started on their mission, someone mentioned shutting off the robot.  The robot was armed with dangerous weapons and became violent, shooting people and chasing some of them in the Martian desert. Val Kilmer appeared in the movies "Top Gun", "Top Secret", "Real Genius", "The Doors", and "Batman Forever".

questions.text: In which of these movies did a toy maker use robots to kill people?
questions.correct: Halloween III: Season of the Witch
questions.explanation:
Halloween III: Season of the Witch.

	After Michael Myers "died" in the hospital explosion at the end of "Halloween 2", John Carpenter decided to do a movie which happened on Halloween, but used a completely different story.  Someone discovered that robots were killing people who knew things about a toy company.  The robots worked for a toy maker who sold Halloween masks to just about everyone.  If someone wearing a mask watched his commercial on Halloween night, a signal from the TV was supposed to turn on a laser in his mask and fry his brain!

questions.text: Who played a robot who built other robots in "Android"?
questions.explanation:
Klaus Kinski.

	I'm giving away a surprise, but it's not much of a surprise anyway.  Dr. Daniel (Klaus Kinski) did experiments with human-looking android robots on a research space station until three escaped criminals arrived.  It was later revealed that Dr. Daniel was also a robot, who was overtaken by a male and female robot he had been tampering with. Klaus Kinski did various movies, including "Nosferatu", "Venom", and "Buddy Buddy" with Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau.

questions.text: What performer from "Places in the Heart" played a robot in "Making Mr. Right"?
questions.explanation:
John Malkovich.

	An emotionless scientist (John Malkovich) created a human-looking robot (John Malkovich) to go on a deep space mission.  A public relations woman (Ann Magnuson) became friends with the robot, and they fell in love.  The robot wanted to stay on Earth, so the scientist and the robot switched places, and the scientist went off into space.  The woman and the robot lived happily ever after! John Malkovich has appeared in various movies, including "Places in the Heart", "Of Mice and Men", "Ripley's Game", and "Being John Malkovich".

questions.text: Who played as Ilia and her robot duplicate in "Star Trek: The Motion Picture"?
questions.explanation:
Persis Khambatta.

	A bald-headed alien, Ilia (Persis Khambatta) got zapped and removed from the Enterprise by a machine calling itself "V-ger".  A robot probe duplicate of Ilia arrived in the starship and told everyone what V-ger was up to.  After deciding that living things were not as good as machines, it was about to wipe out all Earth life, until Decker "joined up" with it. Persis Khambatta (2 Oct 1948 - 18 Aug 1998) was Miss India Universe in 1965 at 17 years old.  She acted in movies including "Nighthawks" (1981), "Megaforce" (1982), "Warrior of the Lost World" (1983), and "Phoenix the Warrior" (1988).  She made guest appearances on "MacGyver", "Mike Hammer", and "Lois and Clark".

questions.text: Who played the bald, murderous robot cowboy in "Westworld"?
questions.explanation:
Yul Brynner.

	"Westworld" was an amusement park inhabited by robots which people could repeatedly shoot and "kill".  Eventually, the robots (androids) fought back, and began killing the customers. Yul Brynner was most famous for "The King and I", "The Magnificent Seven", and "The Ten Commandments".

questions.text: Who played the title character in "Eve of Destruction"?
questions.explanation:
Renee Soutendijk.

	After becoming damaged during a bank robbery, a female robot, EVE VIII (Renee Soutendijk), ran around murdering people.  Col. Jim McQuade (Gregory Hines) and Dr. Eve Simmons (Renee Soutendijk) were sent to stop the robot. Renee Soutendijk was a Dutch actress in various Dutch and U.S. TV shows and TV movies, including "Inside the Third Reich", "Peter the Great", and "Forced March".
